conversations.content: Wheeee hee hee hee ha ha hoo! Now this is FASCINATING!
Pipple.
What IS this specimen? An animal? A plant? Or something else entirely?
Care to accompany me to my lab, little creature? Just think of all the scientific breakthroughs we could engineer together! ...Hm?
We're going to need some real unusual ingredients if we hope to win the contest! Something with OOMPH!
Yeah, you've only said that about a HUNDRED times, girl! I got the memo!
Pi pi piiii!
Huh? Pipple and...Kleimann? What're you two up to?
Working through vital negotiations! Tell me—do you know why this strange critter suddenly started dancing? Is this some kind of ritual?
Oh, that's kinda his thing. It's just his way of saying ＂EAT ME!＂
Pi pi piiii!
Request DENIED!
Pii?!
You might want us to believe you're a vegetable, but how am I supposed to fact-check that?
If I don't know where something comes from, I won't put it in front of my customers. Period.
Piyaaaa?!
There is no reason to fear the unknown. One should investigate it—embrace it! Even taste it, I daresay!
Does studying new ingredients not fall within a culinarian's purview?
Well, sure, but...
Piya, Pipple! Piya!
You're not wrong that Pipple'd certainly make an impact if we served him in the contest, but still...
Well, if you aren't going to investigate this, then I will! To my lab, little fellow!
Hold it, bucko! I'm not about to let you do one of your crazy-dangerous experiments on poor Pipple!
Then how do you propose we discern his true nature?
We...could observe him and write down all our findings! Y'know, like a Pipple Diary!
A...Pipple Diary?
Yeah! We could take turns.
Genius, right? Tell me that's not genius!
I'm on board. Let's do it!
Surely there are more...efficient...means of study, but very well.
Okay, gang! Operation Pipple Diary is a go!
Piiii! ♪
Day 3. The subject has yet to move.
What are you doing, Notte?
Shh! I'm observing Pipple. He's right over there, see?
Pip pii...
Sunbathing in his usual spot, huh?
Yeah. He hasn't moved from that spot for THREE DAYS now. No eating. No trips to the Little Pipple's Room. Nothing.
Seriously?
Yuuup. I mean, I know he's prone to ＂vegging out,＂ but this is ridiculous!
Still, no matter how funky the little guy is, don'tcha think we should try to get to know him better?
We're supposed to be his friends!
You're right. He deserves that.
Then you should help out with our Pipple Diary! C'mon, please!
I'd be happy to help. Just tell me what to do.
You're a lifesav—oh! He just moved! After him!
S-sure...
Today's Observer: Notte  There's still SO much we don't know about Pipple, but we're only just getting started!
Today's Observer: Mitsuba  We all know Pipple wants to be eaten, but he took it to another level today!
Right! Time for me to make some stock!
Hmm... I think I'm craving veggies today. First, I'll fill the pot with water—
Pii! ♪
...Huh?
Piiiiya!
Pipple! In this house, we do NOT bring ourselves to a boil over low heat!
Pi.
Stop trying to get me to cook you. My cookware is for non-sentient ingredients only!
Puu puu?
Have we not been over this several times?
Hey, you two. Why all the commotion?
Oh, just the usual—Pipple clamoring for death's steamy, bubbling-hot embrace.
Stop causing trouble for people, Pipple. I grow tired of repeating this to you.
Puu! Puppuppu!
What? Are you angry now?
Pipple!
Where did he go?
Piye... Piye...
Er, why is he bringing us a bunch of vegetables?
Maybe he decided to cool it after you got mad at him, so now he's trying to help out instead?
Well, no complaints here! I was just thinking that I'd like to perfect my vegetable stock recipe today.
Thanks, little guy! I'll make good use of your gift! Hand them here.
Puu puu!
Huh? You're NOT giving them to us? Then why're you hoarding so many?
This does not bode well.
I don't think I follow.
He didn't bring those vegetables over to help us.
He's taken them hostage—and he won't give them back unless we eat him.
Pi! Piya!
This shocking act marked the start of the great Vegetable War. Without vegetables, how were we supposed to make healthy, nourishing meals?
This is quite the pickle... Er, maybe that was a poor choice of words.
He has all the castle's vegetables in his clutches—and if we don't meet his demands, he won't give them back.
Here's an idea—let's just go buy more.
Puu puu!
I think that's gonna be a no-go, bud.
Why the heck's that?
Even if we could, we had so many vegetables that replacing them all would drain the treasury dry.
But that means we'd have to eat HIM. Does anyone here have the guts to do it?
The stalemate between man and vegetable continued for several days more...
Urgh... I need some veggies already! Or at least vegetable STOCK!
Same. Let's just say my guts ain't happy.
I think that's just because you've been eating too much in general.
You're not wrong that we're all missing veggies in our diets, though.
We really need to do something... But is eating Pipple our only option?
Wait, I have a plan! Leave this to me!
Please don't tell me you're going to—
Pii?!
Glad you could make it, Pipple! It's time to grant your wish. Hop in my pot!
PIYE?!
Heh. Did I get your hopes up? I actually just want to extract some of your nutrients for my stock.
Pipple?
I know that's not exactly what you want, but we'd still be ＂eating＂ you, in a sense. Is that a fair compromise?
Puuu...
I'm sorry. I know you're disappointed.
But believe me when I say we're not trying to upset you or disregard your feelings.
No matter who or what you are, you're our irreplaceable friend.
Piye...?
Can't we meet halfway and make up? Please?
Pi pi piiiiiii!
He's in the pot!
Does that mean you'll forgive me, Pipple?
Pipple!
Excellent. Then let's get this Pipple stock percolating!
Pipple-luu! ♪
Puwaaa...
He looks like he enjoyed that.
Pii pii! ♪
I boiled the water niiice and slow, keeping an eye on the temperature.
Pi?
Don't worry. I haven't forgotten my promise.
Let the taste test...begin!
H-how is it?
Holy smokes! It's actually REALLY GOOD!
...Mmm. You're right. It has a mild, herbaceous flavor. Very mellow.
Pi! Pipple pi!
And so the great Vegetable War came to a shocking conclusion. Even the most soup-averse among us came 'round after a savory sip of Pip.
PIIYEEEEEEE!
Oh, c'mon, Pipple! Don't cry!
Why's he so upset?
Just another day of him violently flinging himself at any piece of cookware in sight.
I...see.
I wish we could learn something about him beyond ＂small, cute, wants to be eaten.＂ Even our Pipple Diary isn't revealing much.
Pipple?
Well, Pipple? Can you help us get to know you better?
Pi pi... Pipple!
Uh, where's he going?
Pii!
I think he wants us to follow him.
Then follow him we shall.
That was quite the trek. ...Aha. I know where we are.
This is where we first met Pipple. I'd never forget.
Oh yeah! You met him while you were out gathering ingredients for the cooking contest, right?
You could say that. In reality, he just started following me.
Chu!
Sounds like he's trying to get our attention.
Oh! Look down at his feet!
Holy guacamole! There're loads of veggies that look just like Pipple! The heck?!
I've never seen anything like it.
Me neither. Neither here nor in Hinomoto.
Pipple!
You think these are his buds or something? But wait: He's alive. Like, ALIVE alive. They're...not. What's up with that?
I believe the answer lies in the mana suffusing this forest.
Observer of Mana Sophie
What brings you here, Sophie?
I could ask all of you the same question.
I'm here to observe the forest's mana, as I often do.
Is there something special about this area? We're quite a ways from the Halidom.
You came all this way without knowing? It's a ＂forest of life,＂ if you will.
What does that mean, exactly?
The mana in this area is peculiar, you see. It all seems to flow to this forest.
It is as if the mana itself desires to coalesce here, beckoning wind and water.
I wasn't aware mana ever behaved in that way.
This is only conjecture, but I think wandering mana comes here in order to create new life.
As you know, the souls of the dead become mana. I theorize that the same mana then comes here to find new vessels and grant them life's blessing.
Assuming my theory is sound, is it not plausible that mana could give life to vegetables, too?
What a imaginative tale.
Hee hee. It's a nice thought, isn't it?
Heh. Someone's blessed you with quite the gift, Pipple.
Pii pii! ♪
So a vegetable growing in the forest was miraculously given life by powerful mana.
How lucky for us to have been in the right place at the right time to meet him.
Talk about one miracle after another!
Pii pii!
Today's Observer: Euden  It turns out Pipple is a miraculous  vegetable born from the forest of life.
But veggie or no, none of us actually want to eat someone we consider a precious friend. I wonder if someone will ever make his wish come true.
This is the place. Are you two ready?
Sure are. Let's show them what we're made of!
Right! Piye!
Today's Observer: Mitsuba  The prince took me and Valerio on a mission to a town near the Halidom.
Three days earlier...
Valerio! Mitsuba! I need your help. We have a culinary crisis on our hands.
Whoa. What's got you looking so grim?
I think it would be better if I explained.
You see, we went out to check the welfare of a town situated south of the forest.
We'd heard the soil wasn't good for growing crops, so we brought the residents some fresh vegetables. But...
What happened?
Well, the adults were happy, but the children...not so much.
If I had to guess, it's probably because they're so used to poor-quality crops that they think all vegetables taste bad.
Cleo tried putting together a vegetable- heavy meal for them, but they showed zero interest.
In all of my years of cooking for others, I've never experienced anything half as humiliating.
It sounds like it's going to be tough turning these kids into veggie believers.
Puu! Puppu!
You said it, Pipple. They don't know what they're missing.
Pipple!
Based on what you just told us, you want us to go to that town and spread the veggie gospel, right?
Please! Don't let my humiliation be in vain!
Piyeh. Pi...
Hey, chill out. It's gonna be okay.
Pi piii...
Oh, there they are!
Ew, not more vegetables! We don't want 'em!
Bring us candy or something!
Well, this looks like a worthwhile project.
Oh, what's that? Some kinda doll?
Pipple?
It can talk?!
This is Pipple. He's a vegetable.
Nuh-uh! Vegetables can't talk or move!
That's because he's a SPECIAL veggie! So be nice to him, kiddo!
R-really? Then... Ooh, I know! Let's go play, Pipple!
Pipple! Pi pi piii!
That should keep them busy. Let's roll up our sleeves and start cooking while they're occupied.
After tasting what we whip up, they're gonna be full-blown veg-a-holics!
So, are you REALLY a vegetable?
Pii!
Huh. Well, then you're the only good one, because I HATE vegetables!
Me too! They're always so bitter and dry.
But then we get yelled at if we don't eat them, and that just makes us hate them even more!
Piye...
Oh no! I'm sorry. Please don't cry.
If there really IS such a thing as a tasty vegetable, I'd love to try it, but...
Same. Maybe then I'd actually learn to like them.
Pipple... Pipple.
What's this? Is it for me?
A...seed?
Chuuu!
Wait! Pipple! Come baaack!
All the ingredients are simmering nicely. If I just leave it all to boil...
Pipple?!
Pi pi piiii!
He just jumped into the pot! Not this again!
Pipple. NO. BAD PIPPLE! Quick, open the lid, or he's gonna—
Pippllleeee!
Today's Observer: Mitsuba  No matter how many times we called his name, Pipple would not respond. The pot's lid stayed firmly closed.
This can't be happening...
Hey! You haven't seen Pipple, have you? He just handed us this seed and ran off.
A seed?
He wanted these kids to learn how tasty vegetables could be—starting with him.
True. Being cooked is what he's always wanted.
Rather than mourn his loss, we should respect his resolve and honor his wishes as only we can.
We have to cook him into the best dish possible! We have to change the way they see vegetables forever!
Couldn't have said it better myself!
Huh? What are you talking about? Where's Pipple?
He's on a very important mission—to help you kids love veggies once and for all!
Here you are: one vegetable stew, loaded with local specialties. Bon appétit.
Urrrgh... It really IS all veggies. I don't wanna eat this...
Just try one bite. If that doesn't win you over, I won't force you to have more.
Well, all right... *munch*
N-no way. It's super yummy! Are there really vegetables in here?!
The ones my mom used to use were never this juicy.
Seasoning and technique make all the difference. That, and having a secret ingredient.
What is it?
A vegetable's pride.
Thank you! Everything was sooo yummy!
I'll tell Mom to use this recipe, I promise!
Make sure to eat your greens so you grow up big and strong, all right?
Okey dokey! Oh, but you never told us where Pipple went.
He...returned to the forest. The forest of life.
Aw, maaan! Then what should I do with this seed?
I think you should try and plant it. Think of it as a memento of the time you spent with Pipple.
Okay! I'll take really good care of it! Thank you!
Today's Observer: Mitsuba  Our parting with Pipple was sudden and bittersweet...but his pride as a vegetable won out in the end.
We gave Pipple his wish. We did the right thing. And so ends the Pipple Diary.
Or so we thought...
I half expected to see Pipple in the pot when I opened it. I miss him already...
Mitsuba! Pipple, he—!
Hmm? Yes, I know, he's...
No, I mean... Just come outside!
Huh?
Pii! Pii! Pii! ♪
PIPPLE?! How?!
I suspect this Pipple came from the seed the former Pipple left to the children.
Oh! That makes sense. ...Kind of?
Pipple!
Well, whatever the case, it's so good to have you back!
Pi pi piii!
Pi pi piiiiii!
Pi pi piiiiiiii!
...Huh? Wait a second. Did I hear an echo or something?
Err, take a look over there.
Pipple!
Puu puu!
Chu chu-chu!
Two, three, four... Just how many Pipples are there?!
That seed must have grown into a whole crop of them.
Can one seed really produce THIS MANY?! It's like there's a whole Pipple army!
Wheeee hee hee hee ha ha hoo!
My apologies, but this explanation defies all reason.
I'm speechless...
Today's Observer: Kleimann  The little rascal has propagated most ferociously! A shame his offspring are making life difficult for the prince.
I've sent fifty Pipples to Hinomoto!
I've returned a hundred Pipples to the forest.
I lugged about fifty to each village with food shortages!
I left 150 Pipples in Picaro's restaurant. I'm sure he'll take care of them.
There are also three of the little scamps in my room! Whee hee hee!
Just don't do anything funny with 'em. We've got Pipples for days already!
Phew... I think that's the Pipple problem dealt with. Good work, everyone.
Chu!
You DO realize what a headache you've been, right?
Piyeeee.
Look on the bright side. We learned just how selfless Pipple can be.
The people in all those villages were overjoyed. Many lives will be saved because of his actions.
I wonder if his mana's regenerative functions have other applications. This calls for further testing!
None of this was a walk in the park— or the forest of life, as it were— but all's well that ends well.
Chu chu-chu!
I'm glad we learned so much about you, Pipple!
Pipple!
Today's Observer: Notte  Mitsuba's going to make some stock from a Pipple to use in the cooking contest. Can you say SLAM DUNK?
When we started this project, we had no idea what Pipple was. Now one thing is clear: he's a paragon of veggie-hood through and through!
Well, that's it for the Pipple Diary! Sweet dreams, veggie lovers!
